name: Tofu Achari "Paneer" - Tofu & Veggies in Achari Sauce
description: Tofu Achari "Paneer" - Tofu & Veggies in Achari Sauce made with Indian Pickling spices. Add chickpeas or more vegetables to make soy-free. Vegan Gluten-free Recipe. Nut-free option
recipeIngredient: 1  hot green chile (, seeds removed to reduce heat, or 1/4 of a green bell pepper)
1/2 cup non dairy yogurt  (or use vegan sour cream or cashew cream made with 1/3 cup cashews blended with 1/2 cup water)
2 cups vegetables such as thinly sliced bell pepper (, broccoli (small florets), peas, zucchini)
1/4 tsp nigella seeds (optional for garnish, cilantro for garnish)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the spices (except red pepper flakes) on a skillet over medium heat until toasted or until fennel seeds start to change color. Mix in the pepper flakes and take off heat. Pulse once in a blender or use a mortar and pestle to break some of the spices. Reserve 1/2 tsp of the mix for garnish.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat the spices (except red pepper flakes) on a skillet over medium heat until toasted or until fennel seeds start to change color. Mix in the pepper flakes and take off heat. Pulse once in a blender or use a mortar and pestle to break some of the spices. Reserve 1/2 tsp of the mix for garnish.

recipeInstructions.text: Prep the tofu. You can use just pressed tofu, or crisped in oil for a few mins, or baked with spices like my Butter tofu.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep the tofu. You can use just pressed tofu, or crisped in oil for a few mins, or baked with spices like my Butter tofu.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion and a pinch of salt and cook until golden. Pulse the garlic, ginger and chile in a blender with a tbsp of water to make a paste. Add the paste to the onion skillet. Alternatively, mince them and add to the onion.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion and a pinch of salt and cook until golden. Pulse the garlic, ginger and chile in a blender with a tbsp of water to make a paste. Add the paste to the onion skillet. Alternatively, mince them and add to the onion.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook for a minute. Add the Achari spice mix(from step 1), coriander, turmeric  and mix in. Cook for another minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook for a minute. Add the Achari spice mix(from step 1), coriander, turmeric  and mix in. Cook for another minute.

recipeInstructions.text: In the same blender blend the tomatoes until smooth and add to the skillet. Alternatively use chopped tomatoes.
recipeInstructions.name: In the same blender blend the tomatoes until smooth and add to the skillet. Alternatively use chopped tomatoes.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook until the tomato mixture is well roasted. Add salt, sugar and non dairy yogurt and mix in.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook until the tomato mixture is well roasted. Add salt, sugar and non dairy yogurt and mix in.

recipeInstructions.text: Add water, tofu, veggies (except broccoli) and mix in. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Taste and adjust salt, flavor and heat. [Add some garam masala for added flavor if needed or add 1-2 tsp mango pickle minus the mango at this point add some esp if omitting some of the spices or for some more flavor burst)]. Add broccoli and mix in. Reduce heat to medium low, Cover and cook for 3 minutes so broccoli is well steamed but not mushy. Uncover and cook for another minute to reduce sauce if needed. Take off heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Add water, tofu, veggies (except broccoli) and mix in. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Taste and adjust salt, flavor and heat. [Add some garam masala for added flavor if needed or add 1-2 tsp mango pickle minus the mango at this point add some esp if omitting some of the spices or for some more flavor burst)]. Add broccoli and mix in. Reduce heat to medium low, Cover and cook for 3 minutes so broccoli is well steamed but not mushy. Uncover and cook for another minute to reduce sauce if needed. Take off heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Garnish with the reserved achari spices, more nigella seeds (and some cayenne for additional heat) and cilantro. Serve with flatbread or with rice or grains.
recipeInstructions.name: Garnish with the reserved achari spices, more nigella seeds (and some cayenne for additional heat) and cilantro. Serve with flatbread or with rice or grains.
